Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Selita57
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Barcelona Center Hotel during our recent Spain vacation. The rooms were beautiful and clean. The service was excellent. A little out of the way but well worth it. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: jessica4321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our recent Spain trip. It was a nice hotel with updated rooms/bathroom. We really loved the shower! The beds were a bit hard and the rooms were pretty small. The room was EXTREMELY hot when we arrived and we turned down the heat but it seemed to take a few hours for it to cool down to a comfortable temperature. There was free WIFI which was nice and the hotel had a nice bar where we got a drink at night. The location was great and we did not notice any subway or street noise at all. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Its a good price for what you get and we had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Victor L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine. Clean room but a little deteriorated. Bathroom is nice and clean. In my opinion, the only issues was: no free tv service, no breakfast included and the hotel is a little bit far from the ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glengy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this weekend,Very very helpful staff(Thank you Milan) rooms were spotless,Great location,Had read about traffic noise,Well,Coming from Rural Staffordshire,My wife and i never really noticed the traffic,There are two Jacuzzi's on the roof,One hot,One cold,lending fabulous views of the streets below,There is also a small gym and sauna which were spotless too We will be returning their sometime soon as we feel it was an absolute gem Thanks again to all the helpful staff,We hope anyone finds this helpful

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alexia P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely weekend in Barcelona last December. Loved the hotel and the city. We will be back. The staff was very friendly and the hotel facilities amazing. My favourite part must be the jacuzzi on the roof top and a small gym + sauna next to it. Great location. I would recommend this hotel to all in fact my work colleague is enjoying the good living there over this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: bails999
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 306 (a superior room from 2nd to 7th April) and what a room it was. The bed was huge, much larger than a king!, there was a well stocked mini bar, massive walk in wardrobe, excellent street side view out of the window. The roof terrace looked very smart although the bar wasn't open, due to the season. However we did get to se the jacuzzi. Check in was swift and staff were polite and very helpful throughout. Special thanks to the doorman/luggage handler who was very helpful in providing umbrellas on days it rained...which is a touch I liked. We had breakfast one morning and it consists of cold continental and hot scrambled eggs sausage and bacon. All of good quality. There has been a few comments about noise from the traffic.....our room overlooked the front and you could just about hear traffic, but that wasn't a problem. The location is very good, close to resturants, a couple of blocks from the underground and a 20 minute stroll to Las Ramblas. Overall, an excellent hotel which was friendly, clean and quiet

Reviews.Title: “superbly located, friendly and helpful staff, excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lillovestravel
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel on the basis of its location. it is so close to everything yet in a lovely quiet neighbourhood . all the staff were extremely helpful. the rooftop jacuzzi and sauna were great. the rooms were fab with the best hotel shower i have ever used. i would stay there again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: SuePete4
Reviews.Content: As always, we booked this hotel after studying other reviews on Trip Advisor. We can only add to all the positive ones! This is a lovely hotel-spotlessly clean, tastefully furnished & decorated, well placed for sightseeing with friendly & helpful staff, especially Kalvi on reception. We booked a standard double room, it had 2 large wardrobes, dressing table, large chest of drawers, flat-screen TV, one armchair plus one "dining" chair. The bathroom was HUGE-it had a large section with WC, bidet, wash-basin set in a large vanity unit, lots of mirrors, good lighting and small hairdryer. A glass door led to a wet room with power shower plus full-size bath with overhead shower and heated bath rail. Someone wrote that the rooms were noisy from traffic, but we were overlooking the junction of Balmes & Mallorca and we couldn't hear a thing when the window was closed. Just 2 (very) slight minus points-no kettle/tea & coffee making facilities in the rooms, (but we always take our own) and although the hotel allows smoking in the rooms (big plus for us) it doesn't provide ashtrays! I'd advise you to take your own. Breakfast was very good. Hot buffet comprising eggs, bacon, sausages, tomatoes. Also various cold meats, cheeses, olives, cold tomatoes, cereals, fresh fruits, yoghurt, pastries, sliced breads & rolls. Fruit juices, bottled water and tea, coffee, cappucino and hot chocolate As stated previously, the hotel is in a very good location for most of the sights. If, like us, you are happy to walk about, don't bother to buy a ticket for the hop on-hop off tour bus. It costs 27 Euros (discounted to 24 if you buy from the hotel) but is only valid for 1 day. Las Ramblas is about 15-20 minutes walk (down Balmes) and La Sagrada is about 30 minutes walk along Mallorca (admission is 16 Euros, but worth it) Casa Mila is about 10-15 minutes walk (along Mallorca and turn left into Gracia) This costs 15 Euros and gets you onto the roof (spectacular!) into "the attic" (amazing!) and round 2 apartments furnished in the style of Gaudi's era (really interesting!) If you walk up Balmes, about 2 blocks away, there is a Bistro/bar called Balmes Rossallo-highly recommended. Prices very reasonable and delicious food-particularly the pizzas. This hotel is part of a chain and has premises in Madrid, Valencia, Seville, Granada (and somewhere else I can't remember) Like the Leonardo in Berlin, I'd visit another city just to stay in one of their hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: dianazi
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Barce late night and when I saw 4 **** I told myself yeah right, In hotel fairyland maybe. Im not sure if they are quite 4* worthy but our stay was pleasant. We had everything we needed and the staff is helpful. They have a breakfast buffet which is not so bad. Not the tastiest eggs or the most diverse food Ive seen but gets you full. I guess that should do it. The buffet for me is definitely 3* (maybe two and a half). The people who service in the morning aren't the happiest looking staff, they all seem angry or unhappy but thats OK I guess. As for our room, it was perfect. They have a sauna and jacuzzi on 7th floor but never visited. I would definitely revisit if I headed back to Barce on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pandiani
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently for 4 nights, we got a good rate on the alpharooms website. On reading the reviews here I e-mailed the hotel prior to arrival requesting a street side room. Check-in was very pleasant, man on reception was very friendly and helpful and answered any queries we had about the area. All staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. Room was very nice overlooking Calle de Balmes, not much noise from the street. Room is nicely decorated and comes with a safe free of charge and also a mini-bar. Mini-bar prices were reasonable although I did not purchase anything from it. Also had no issues with air conditioning mentioned in a previous review. There are 2 metro stops a couple of blocks from hotel : Diagonal and Passeig de Gràcia. La Ramblas and Plaça de Catalunya are about a 10 minute walk away. There are 2 hot tubs on the roof with a very small gym and sauna. Wi-fi is provided free of charge. I would stay at this hotel again if visiting Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: farmboy227
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel , nothing to much trouble. Amazing food, Serreno ham for breakfast every day! Hot tub on the roof was a big hit too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the basics - excellent location (20 minute walk to La Rambla) nice staff, free WiFi, spacious room, comfortable bed, big bathroom and so forth. But I was not pleased with the breakfast; for 17 Euro it was bad with a meager selection, and the coffee was terrible. Worse, the room temperature was almost unbearable - it was 27 degrees C overnight (81 F) and although there was a thermostat in the room, it did not adjust to the temp but simply blew more hot air. Luckily I was only there one night, or I would have switched rooms the next day. I won't mention that I burned my hand badly on the halogen light bar over the mirror, since I did not complain about it to the front desk when I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality for that price, great stay”
Reviews.Author: winnsley
Reviews.Content: I had to stay there for business, and the few moment I was free, it was only rest and total relax in my room or on the marvelous terrace, or strolling around that marvelous city... if you like to walk a little, you are at the center of everything!!! I must had that the service was great and people there will really do the maximum to help and solve everything.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lyssi_d
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my sister in November 2011. The hotel is nice, clean, decent size room with cupboards either side of bed, so easy to put stuff away and stay organised. Hotel will probably need a bit of a refresh decoration wise soon, as it is starting to look tired if you look closely enough. Our bathroom was modern, but we did experience sewage smells coming up through the plumbing at various times, but this wasn't continuous and not at night so was possible to deal with. We didn't really enjoy the food in the hotel restaurant, but only ate there in the first place as we arrived late. The location of the hotel is great, we knew we didnt want to be on the ramblas as it would be too noisy, and this hotel put us just a 10 minute walk from the ramblas, 5 mins to all other main streets. Plenty of good restaurants surrounding the hotel too. Overall would recommend the hotel, mainly due to its location, but definatley worth staying here if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlTravelalot
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. Of all the hotels we visited in Barcelona, Grenada, Valencia and Toledo, this was my favorite. Our room had two separate closets on each side of the bed, which made it easy to keep the room organized and clean. The bedroom and bathrooms are large. The staff is extremely accomodating. The location is also perfect. We stayed in this hotel at the beginning of our trip to Spain and we returned for the last few days of our visit, since we loved Barcelona and this hotel so much. We were given rooms facing the street for both visits. We had balconies, so we could stand outside and see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location choose your room wisely”
Reviews.Author: XavierMelisse
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly. location is good. restaurants within walking distance. clean. rooms are tobe chosen wisely. many are with view on internal yard of the hotel - nothing to see there and airco not working in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Siobh8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my mother, we were looking for a centrally located hotel, close to everything and that it was. The location was excellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the doormen. However our bedroom was not satisfactory, it was dark and located at the back of the hotel. The window was facing into a courtyard adjoining other bedrooms and was small and dark like a prison cell. I had to ring reception in the mornings to confirm the weather for the day as there was no light entering the room. All in all the experience was fine but the room was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for the city center”
Reviews.Author: sharkyuae
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights during a recent business trip to my company HQ in Sant Cugat and despite the central location of the hotel the morning commute to Sant Cugat rarely took more than 40 minutes in many ways due to the nice grid road system in Barcelona. Car parking was Euro23 per night, however the free Wi Fi was well appreciated, I still do not understand why even major hotel chains such as Intercontinental and Sofitel continue to charge ridiculous amounts of money to access the internet. The room was comfortable, although the television was very temperamental, but main news channels are available. Breakfast was included, and fair to say above basic. We used the bar / restaurant on the first evening and the food quality was a reasonable standard. One of the key points is the location to the main center literally within walking distance to many restaurants, Gaudi architecture and a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: A.B.GBirmingham
Reviews.Content: 5 of us went to Barcelona in the October half term and we were given the task of locating a hotel - a bit nerve wracking when booking for 3 others! We needn't have worried, the Center was absolutely perfect for us. I had emailed the hotel and asked for adjacent rooms, which we got. The rooms themselves were exactly as described: modern, with neutral decor (a wardrobe each!) and a lovely bathroom with real toiletries (not those 'cheap' and tacky dispensers as found in some hotels). We had booked 'room only' but found that breakfast could be reserved the night before for about 14 euros and we thought it was good value for a city centre hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful; reception staff went out of their way to be helpful (they tried to get us tickets for a football match) and the 'doormen' were always willing to have a little chat. The public rooms were quite impressive (there were a couple of big functions while we were there and furniture was moved so efficiently and quickly, it was like being at Hogwarts!) We went up to have a look at the roof top terrace and hot tub - lovely!. The service in the bar was a little slow - but we were on holiday, so who cares? We liked the location and although the street was busy there was little traffic noise in the rooms. It is only about 10 minutes from Plaza Catalunya (weirdly though, taxi drivers seemed to have trouble locating it - tip carry a 'hotel card') We visited the football stadium (and that's 2 hours of MY life I won't get back!!) Gaudi obviously - big tip, Casa Batllo: get there before 9 to beat the queues and Sagrada Familia: start queuing NOW (honestly!). Restaurants: we love Agua at Port Olimpic and we had a celebration dinner at Tenorio on Passeig de Gracia (food was good, service and wine also good - not cheap, but not overpriced.)

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Steve_thePeaman
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations and we booked rooms at a reasonable rate. Well placed with north end of la Ramblas a short walk away. Rooms were very comfortable and modern and FREE wifi in the room was a real bonus. Staff were very helpful and when we returned to Barcelona two weeks later after a cruise with a long wait for an evening flight they offered to look after our luggage and use of their facilities. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here this year :)”
Reviews.Author: katieloumatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May and September this year. Beautiful hotel, well situated with helpful staff. Lovely terrace area on the roof top with 2 jacuzzis and plenty of sunbeds and areas to relax. Staff very helpful and informative, helped us to source tickets to see George Michael!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jackiebarbosa
Reviews.Content: the rooftop is amazing, the bedroom was huge, comfortable and very classy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Standards, Very Convenient, First Class”
Reviews.Author: richierich6573
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TA comments and so glad we did. The service was impeccable, cleanliness superb and the quality of the rooms was very chic but not OTT. Very efficient staff who helped us reserve tables at very popular restaurants and the location was perfect for sight seeing and going out into the city in the evening. Set in a quiet street off the La Ramblas made easy walking distance to nearby bars and restaurants. Don't believe all the bad press you may read about crime on La Ramblas - we did not see any trouble and felt safe walking around at night. The hotel has a large breakfast room so you will get a table even at busy times. The hotel bar is very chic and serves excellent drinks (if a little pricey - though most hotel bars are anyway), the bar does serve food, but in the evening lacks a bit of atmosphere as most people seem to head out into the city to eat and so they seem to play this down in the dinner aspect. Nevertheless we will be staying here again on our next visit as it was top stuff! Don't forget your bathers - there is a hot tub on the roof terrace which has good city views and is very pleasant in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: acermelrose
Reviews.Content: Stayed here quite a few times and it is superb ,why ?? The Location The Staff 100% first class and The Hotel, is Central for everything Subway, Rambles,Gaudi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravlerNaplesFL
Reviews.Content: Have stayed four nights at the hotel, with recommendation of my travel agent. The location is in a quiet neighborhood, but just two blocks from the main shopping street and 10 minutes walk to the touristy Old Town part of Barcelona. You are also within two blocks of a clean efficient subway system that can transport you efficiently to any destination in the city. Now the Hotel. A Four Star hotel should have a lobby. The small lobby of this hotel was constitently being used as a private meeting room or reception area for conferences. The rooms were average with a single window that provides inadequate brightness to your room. The beds were rock hard and after four nights I have a sore back when walking. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We had a couple of requests and each time the staff was at the room within minutes of our call and in each instance the issue was resolved satisfactorly. The air conditioning seemed flawed as it could not keep up during the day and evening but by morning the room was very cold. The breakfast is not worth the cost and is the same each day. You are better off going down the street each morning for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dabbler45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of an organized tour, so I don't know whether the hotel is good value or not, but we were very satisfied. The rooms are large and clean (although the air conditioning was not cold enough), the staff is pleasant, the breakfasts were good, the internet worked, and the hotel is very centrally located, in walking distance to many neighborhoods and close to the Metro and bus lines.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to discover Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Gerd200
Reviews.Content: A good hotel to discover Barcelona, nice family room. In the area there are excellent restaurants. One miner point is the metro line that is under the hotel, sometimes you hear and feel them.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Christian19822
Reviews.Content: This hotel give you great value for money. Its high standard and situated 2 blocks from The upper part of la Rambla. Rooms are spaceous and the area is quiet at night. It feels safe. Wifi is free but poor signal made us use 3G instead. This should be fixed. Breakfast is expensive, so we ate at The local coffebars. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “well located pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: dermotty
Reviews.Content: slept in interconnecting rooms,one facing street which was roomy and airey,second room internal and a little dark.roof jacuzzi area a real bonus in summer,general area very nice with plenty of restaurants and shops.defnitely recomend particulary if price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooftop terrace and jacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: hmuk09
Reviews.Content: Great location - few minutes' walk to La Pedrera on Pg de Gracia - lots of great restaurants and bars nearby, as well as lots of shops and a couple of Gaudi masterpieces. The room was spacious and comfortable, but unfortunately they'd just pushed two single beds together (should have told them when we arrived but were too exhausted). Great rooftop terrace (you can see Tibidabo and Sagrada Familia), jacuzzi often unoccupied in the morning. Highly recommend Cerveseria Catalana and Igueldo nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JCMan
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here last week. Very nicely appointed rooms with hot-tubs and a bar on the roof. Located in a real neighborhood away from the noisy tourist centers - but close enough to be able to walk to many attractions or hop on one of two close Metro stops. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Second time, if back in BCN will be book again for sure”
Reviews.Author: LollyMontreal
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We were in BCN for 3 nights on business in another part of town and wanted 3 nights in the center for holiday. We chose to go back to this hotel cuz of its great location. It's very walking and public transport convenient. As they registered my name in their computer and saw that we were return customers they treated us as loyal customers asking us which room we would prefer. Room, amenties, cleanliness all A-OK. Roof terrasse is lovely. Restaurant = not. We had breakfast outside the hotel. Definetely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Center by name Centre by nature.”
Reviews.Author: Yorkyibbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this excellent hotel for a 3 night break. My wife is disabled and found everything about this Hotel just right, from the ramp at the entrance to the larger disabled room with bathroom facilities. The only problem was the lack of a walk-in shower making the bath the only non-disabled friendly item. We have mentioned this to staff. Very clean and recently updated rooms make for a very bright hotel and the roof terrace containing two jacuzzis and a wonderful view over the city is the perfect sun trap. Oh and not forgetting one of the best Tapas bars is just 75 yard away, what more could you ask....?

Reviews.Title: “Some minor issues but overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paren
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel name is 'Hotel Barcelona Center', not 'Barcelona Center Hotel' as it is on Tripadvisor in case this has confused anyone. The hotel is about 30-45 minutes away to the end of La Rambla (by the Columbus Monument). Initial impressions were very good, lovely decor and friendly staff. After seeing some reviews on TA beforehand, I asked at check in if I could have an exterior room but was told they are fully booked. However, the internal room wasn't *too* bad. It did have a [small] window to allow some sunlight to come in but don't expect a huge balcony. For a solo traveller like myself, I'd say it's fine. Room size wasn't too bad considering I was a solo traveller, maybe a bit small if you're with a family. The bathroom was very nice, although the bath handle came off and the shower kept leaning to one side, resulting in the water going out! On my first night, I noticed a form behind the door handle which said I was required to fill out and leave outside the night before in order to get breakfast. I called reception beforehand to ask to confirm if I still had to fill this out although I was going to go to the buffet and they said yes. The following morning, I opened the door to leave for breakfast to find a hotel worker delivering it via room service to me! Be advised, nowhere on the form did it say this was for room service, and the hotel also charged me €5, which again was also not stated on the form. The breakfast itself wasn't anything truly special. Bread/cakes/croissants/hot drinks/cerials/scrambled eggs and bacon. There was also different types of ham which I wasn't keen on trying. Communication for me was very important, and one of the reasons I chose this hotel was due to the free Wi-Fi. However, I soon realised that I was not picking up any signal in my room. After calling the reception, they said that Wi-Fi is only available in the lobby and that I should connect the Ethernet cable in my room should I want Internet access there. Okay, not a major issue but it kind of restricts you to a corner of the room unless you take a longer cable with you. The main issue with the Internet though was that it kept cutting off and was very slow. This was in particular annoying when I wanted to check in online for my return flight so that I could choose my seat - it took over 20 minutes of me refreshing the page to finally connect. Again, when reception were informed, was told the hotel was 'fully booked' and there was not a lot they could do about it. The bed itself was a little hard for my liking, but I suppose they cannot perfect it for everyone. I did notice a 'Pillow Menu' in my room which gave suggestions for different types of pillows to suit different guests, but it did not state how to order them. On departure, the staff were vey friendly, organised a taxi for me and kept me updated on the progress whilst I sat in the hotel lobby etc. The porter knew which terminal I was flying from when I told him my airline, and then told the taxi driver (as I cannot speak Catalan/Spanish). Overall, a lovely hotel but the issues mentioned spoiled the trip slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, defiantly will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MPeretz
Reviews.Content: We spend the weekend in the hotel, My wife, baby girl and I, from Feb 18th till Feb 20st. The hotel is at a great location 5min walk from the all the sites activities and the walk is in beautiful shopping avenue. The hotel standard rooms are big, new & very clean. The staff are generous and the hotel have a great restaurant. To package all that the price was even for both weekday and weekend which represent a very good value for money, defiantly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gilly027
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a luxury affordable hotel then you cant go wrong with this hotel. The staff were polite and professional and the rooms were comfortable. Dont expect a large room but do expect it to be comfortable and clean. The beds when we first sat on them felt really hard and I thought we would have a bad sleep but suprisingly enough the beds were very comfortable. It also has a nice bar down stairs that serve great cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: jimmyLimerick Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: the location is good hotel clean and friendly staff exterior room was very comfertable

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vivifonfon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very well located, all facilities, some rooms with terrace. 5mns walking distance from Rambla Catalunya and 10mns fromPaseo de Gracia. Clsoe to Cervezeria Catalana which is one of the very good tapas bar in BCN Very afforadble depending on dates as yield management in Barcelona gets crazy. If you can get a rate between 85 to 95€, it is definitely good value for money in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfasts, Good Location, but.....”
Reviews.Author: ChefDon10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to the metro and bus stops which will carry you anyplace in Barcelona. We stayed a total of 6 days (on two trips). The breakfasts are well prepared and plentiful. The reception area is small and the desk staff is excellent and helpful. The restaurant is clean, but expensive. We did not eat there, but opted to go to a seafood tapas bar recommended by the staff, two blocks away, which was fantastic (we ate there 5 times). The halls are dark and the air quality in the halls and rooms are musty. Cleaning staff is mediocre. Twice we left early in the AM leaving the "please clean the room" sign out only to return in the late afternoon to find it not cleaned yet. Rooms are of good size for Barcelona and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: danika_ma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best we stayed in in europe. for the price we paid it was great value for money. It made our trip in barcelona especially with the rooftop jaccuzi and lounges. The location of the hotel was great close to la rambla and a nice leasurely walk everywhere else. The hotel staff were extremly helpful and reliable. The rooms were also very nice and regularly cleaned and tidied. The only bad thing i could say about this hotel was the bed which was a little too hard for my liking. However all up the hotel and rooftop made our trip to barcelona absolutly fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: porpora
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and at the Hotel Jazz and enjoyed both immensely. The staff at Barcelona Center was superlative and the rooms clean and well-appointed. The location was excellent. We'd gladly book a room here again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Penn_00
Reviews.Content: Great stay. We stayed elsewhere for 2 nights (same location) and wanted to extend for a 3rd night and were quoted a ridiculous amount at the last minute. So we "door knocked" the area and the staff were helpful, rate was great, and the rooms and facilities (especially the jacuzzi on the top deck) were a hit. They even have valet parking which we never got anywhere else for similar parking price. Great location, go have breakfast at a cafe close by and take the train into Las Ramblas and the beach or walk, not far. Our rate was not as high as the price below recommend, we paid 97e for the night.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: trazi
Reviews.Content: a fine place with fine staff. nothing special, but if you get a good rate, take it. it is clean and in a great location. Only bad part was that our only window opened into a covered alley or something like that... so no fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LucyFM
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. It is in a great location just off the beaten track but convenient for a couple of metro stations (we tended to use Pasaig de Gracia but I don't think it was the closest). The number 17 bus goes from just outside to Barcelonetta (although it stops quite early in the evening so don't rely on it for a night out). It was easy to walk from here to most of the important sights. The rooms were clean and modern (and our cleaner was lovely). The staff were helpful and friendly (which is more than I can say about Barcelona bus drivers!). THe public areas were clean and relaxing. The clear highlight of this hotel is the two hot tubs on the roof next to the Mojito bar! This may prevent you from doing as much sightseeing as you like... Only one minor issue (and this was probably my fault).... the air conditioning had a mind of its own. We woke up in the middle of the night believing that we have fallen asleep in Scotland in January.. What had happened was the air conditing reset itself to 5 degrees... At 89 euros per night would absolutley stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review - Extremely Surprised - The Hotel was a delight!”
Reviews.Author: Paulatb
Reviews.Content: Hi Guys, please read this for a honest review... Myself and my partner are just back from a long weekend in Barcelona and I knew the hotel was going to be pretty good from reading the review, and it was very very good. From the moment we got there the staff spoke excellent English and we got a really nice room over looking the main road. The room itself was extremely big and very modern however contemporary decorated. The cleanliness was very high. The location itself was min or 2 walk to the main shopping area and 10 mins walk to La Rambla, however it was very very quiet which was nice. The roof top area was gorgeous, 2 cracking Jacuzzi's and nice bar etc where we spent out first afternoon relaxing and it was bliss. Food in the hotel was extremely good also. I highly recommend this hotel and would even go back myself. Cheers, Paul

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: g8-1tourguest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2 nights and had a great stay. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and spoke English very well. They helped with bus and metro questions and gave ideas of sights to see. The location is centrally located and 1 block from the provenca/diagonal metro station. Bus 17 takes you straight to the beach from the front door. Check in was quick and easy. The rooms were very clean and updated. I stayed on the second floor and the street noise was bareable. The mattress was kind of hard. The breakfast was really good with a wide selection. I highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: TravellorsTravellors
Reviews.Content: Well appointed, modern rooms.Short walk to La ramblas. Excellent staff and service. Very helpful with restaurants and sightseeing. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaDoverDelaware
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was splendid - the rooms, the staff, the location, the food, the ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “What a professional and gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dee_ukLondon
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in Barcelona on our way home from Majorca during the recent volcanic ash delays. Not only was this a lovely hotel but the staff were exteremely helpful and friendly. When we had to extend our stay by three extra nights, they charged us very resonable rates and when we had to suddenly check out at 7pm on the second to last night because of a bus connection to London, they did not even charge us for that night or the following one. After hearing many stories of hotels taking advantage and charging exorbitant rates during the recent problems, this hotel has to be commended. Lovely buffet breakfast roo!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, just outside of the main hurly burly. Great roof-top bar with jacuzzis which comes alive in the evening!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherB_10 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms, quiet and comfortable. Plenty of choice at breakfast and good quality food. Roof top bar lively but not noisy at night. A nice vibe with the jazuzzis open then too. We also used the jacuzzi in the morning before brekki when it was just us - so one each and enjoyed the morning sun.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: CKaSi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fairly upmarket location, close to designer boutiques and a variety of nice restaurants that are within walking distance to major attractions such as Casa Pedera, Casa Batillo and one of the main shopping streets, Passeig de Gracia. The hotel room was very clean, spacious, quiet, well-furnished and in an excellent and lovely location. The only downside was the fact that the room was very dark as our window faced a walled compound which did not catch any sunlight so we had to turn on all the lights during the day! The plus-side was that it was extremely quiet (if you discount the faint rumblings of the understand which is not really a problem unless you are a very light sleeper). That was not really a problem for us as the hotel met all our expectations. A few people have complained about the bed but I didn't find it uncomfortable. The hotel has a restaurant but I would not recommend it for dinner - service staff are lovely but unfortunately the food is not very good. Thankfully there are lots of good restaurants all within walking distance but avoid the peak times! We felt very safe walking around at night even when there weren't a lot of people around (unlike El Ravel which is pretty dodgy at night). We also had a late flight but the hotel staff were happy to store our luggage for us all day and we picked them up around 6pm. Would definitely stay here again and recommend for those who want to be centrally located in a nice hotel and away from the hustle and bustle of La Ramblas. Use the airport shuttle which will take you to Placa de Catalunya (main centre). From there it is about a 20min walk to the hotel. A really good tapas restaurant a few minutes walk away (near Passeig de Gracia) is Cerveseria Catalana. Go early though (no later than 1.30pm for lunch or 8pm for dinner) as this restaurant is always busy during the peak lunch and dinner period! Also try Mauri cafe on the corner of Passeig de Gracia for breakfast or afternoon tea - they have great selection of pastries, little hamburgers and cakes. It's also worthwhile using the Barcelona Bus Turistic for one or two days as they take you to all the major (and some smaller) attractions which will save a lot of time as the sites are quite spread out. But there is also a metro station close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location! Lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: aprillawton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a group of over 50 people. Check-in was a breeze and the rooms were ready. The front staff desk went above and beyond to help us and were always friendly and fast. A special thanks to a nice young man named Alex! Very funny and helpful staffer. The breakfast buffet was included with our stay and we always enjoyed it. The internet was free in our rooms. We ate at the Balmes 103 restaurant on the premises and really liked the food and service. The sangria was yummy there too. Some people in our group found the beds hard but mine was fine. The sheets could have been softer but no big complaints. Bring conditioner for your hair as this was not included. Hairdryer was fine in the bathroom. The streets are noisy so if you are sensitive to this bring ear plugs. We had no trouble sleeping without earplugs. There are two whirpool tubs on the roof, one is warm the other freezing. We liked hanging out in the warm one and never found it too be crowded. There is a beautiful roof top terrace too, a nice place for a picnic lunch and a beer. This location is very central and gave us many options for shopping and eating. We loved Barcelona, loved Tarragona and wish we never had to leave! Overall a good value hotel and we liked it there.

Reviews.Title: “Best in service.”
Reviews.Author: steffi93
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Barcelona Center few weeks ago and loved it. The location was excellent, only 3 minutes walk from Passeig De Gracia, Rambla Catalunya, Casa Pedera and Casa Batillo. The rooms were fine, modern, nice bedding and enough storage. But the main point that will stick in our memories was the super friendly and helpful front desk staff. From the moment we arrived (after midnight, due flight delay) the smiley and very charming receptionist welcomed us and explained the local attractions and bus routes, recommended restaurants and then we were shown up to our rooms by the bell boy. The staff english is excellent and all of this was done in a non pushy way and they did not seem to be openly expecting tips in return. On the day we checked out , left our bags all day and used their bathroom facilities to get changed ahead of the return to cold Italy. Herby my special thanks to Tiberto, Maria and Kelvi. you guys made our stay so memorable and pleasant with your knowledge and help. Our room overlooked Balmes street but due to the 2 layers of glazing there was no noise, despite this being weekend when Barcelona is usually very noisy during night-time. The other major selling point was the huge Jacuzzi tubs on roof terrace which really helped us both ' relax'. And it is free to use. Overall an great hotel with a top location and 5 star customer service.

Reviews.Title: “DECENT HOTEL, 4star quality, very good location”
Reviews.Author: mick054
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel barcelona centre at around 1am, easy check in, all night reception. Nice big spacious room, good facilities. Typical 4 star hotel, NOT A 5 STAR, so please dont expect it! Its fine though, would stay again, great location. very central. we didnt try breaky. the main thing we found is that it was a bit dusty in the rooms, even after the cleaning had been done! Other than that, its fine. great roof top jacuzzi, free!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lbes
Reviews.Content: Is stayed here for four nights during a business conference. Room was similar in size to American hotel rooms. Very clean room, comfortable bed, good linens, soap, shampoo. Staff was very helpful - helped with directions to many places, printed my boarding pass for next flight. I ate breakfast buffet in hotel everyday - nice variety for big and small appetites. Fitness room is tiny - thee machines and some weights, but is on the roof and has very nice views ! I ran in the neighborhood in the early mornings and felt very safe. Walking distance (10 min) to Rambla, shopping, metro stops. Very easy to get around this city !

Reviews.Title: “Good position - Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJKEastSussex Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2009 for a two night city break. The hotel was in a good location five minutes walk from La Rambla. The hotel lacked any atmosphere; staff were ok but not over friendly. Our room looked luxurious but was very dark and needed a light on even during the day. Although the room was well appointed and clean, the worst part was the bed as it was so very hard, and in the two nights we stayed we did not have a good night sleep. The breakfast room was located in the basement and felt very enclosed, food was average. However, do not be late as you will not be allowed in for breakfast, as they were very quick to shut the doors and pack up on time, and we saw people being turned way. Would we stay again? NO

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel in a reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller2569
Reviews.Content: That was the third time that I stayed in that hotel. First time I chose it because of the lower price (keeping in mind hotels in Barcelona are extremelly overpriced and majority don't even include breakfast in quote) comparing to other centrally located establishments and have to say wasn't dissapointed. It offers a good combination of reasonable quolity accomodation and fairly central location-about 7-10 min walking to Placa de Catalunia. It has to be said though it feels more like accomodation pension rather as a proper hotel as it is situated in a building a multiple block building looking more like one of many houses in this area containing private flats. Location is quite good as Passeig de Gracia mear 5min away and there are scores of excellent restaurants and tapas bars as well as a wide choice of chain and designer shops. Famous Gaudi's Casa Battlo, Casa Amatler (part of the block of discordia) as well as La Pedrera are all within short walking distance and there are subway stations (1.35 Euro for a sinle trip) neraby if you are lazy and tired of exploring the city on foot. The only drowback I can recall about the hotel is that breakfast was not impressive at all and actually hot dishes were half cold. Also if you don't bring your own lap top they charge you 5 euros for half an hour which is considering that the average price is £100.00 per night and more is a bit outrageous. This time shower in my room didn't work very well (there was some leak so upon finishing I has a small pond in the bahroom) but it's was fairly a minor problem) and after I complainted about that they offered some small discount off the price :) Otherwise it was a great weekend in a great city offering plenty of sightseeing, excellent food and amazing atmosphere. Apart from obvious tapa bars I would suggest to try local ice cream sold from branches od Dino's scattered around central area. It is truly delicios, especially pistachio. Now pack you stuff, buy tickes and go ;) It's still +22-24C and by times even feels humid! If have a spare day a trip to Girona (about an hour trip by bas or train) is definatelly worth a visit for its unique feel and spectacular surroundings

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: tudorfour
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Check in efficient. Staff very helpful. Good, well located base to explore barcelona. Would recommend it to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: scmk3000
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel close to midnight but no problem checking in. At that point I did mind the distance a little bit as I was exhausted after a full day work and the flying. Staff at the receiption were warm and helpful during my stay. I was given a room on the 6th floor. Room was big enough but I wouldn't say spacious. My room was facing the back of houses so not a noise throughout my stay - definately couldn't hear any trams passing by. Bathroom was clean with enough space and had a tub with the shower over it. They provided clean towels and topped up toiletries daily. **note to those who do use hair-conditioner, bring your own as they don't seem to provide that in the two hotels that I stayed**. Cabled internet connection was free and reasonbly fast - which was important to me. Breakfast was included with my room and it was good with enough choices I guess. Two juices, choices of difference coffees from two nice espresso machines, plenty of fruits, pastries, plenty of cold cuts and cheeses, bread, cereals, yogurts and the usual sausages and bacons and egg - I wish they had more than just scrambled eggs though. Went to the 'gym' - located on the roof - a couple of times. I must say I expected slightly better than a small small room with no A/C. It had one cycle machine, one rowing machine and one treadmill one right next to another - and they were not of the latest models by any scretch of imagination either. The room was about 10ftX8ft with sauna right behind the machines and a shower room with no door. The jacuzzis were nice but the hot one was far too hot. But because there wasn't a proper bathroom facilities, I had to go back to my room wrapped in towels...lol. Didn't mind but sort of expected better facilities at gym/jucuzzi areas. Location-wise, it wasn't too bad. A bit of a walk to/from the Ramblas but not too excessive for me, perhaps 15-20mins? But can be a bit much if you are tired or hate walking. The hotel however is quite close to the Passeig de Gracia. Out of the hotel, cross the road in front of it and continue for 5-10 mins et voila. The tapas restaurant everyone talks about is on the way just before you hit the passeig. The area, I felt was quite safe as I was out at 1-2am a couple of times and didn't feel I was in any danger. One complaint though, my bed (with some sort of moveable mechanisms) was making loudish squeaky noise as you turn - I asked the hotel staff to come and have a look a couple of time but no one ever turned up or at least nothing had been done. I wasn't even told if they ever attempted to resolve the problem either.... Overall, the stay was OK. As I extended my visit and stayed in another hotel (Barcelo Hotel), I must admit I prefer Barcelo - similar price, much nicer....would I stay again or recommend it to a friend...? Probably not...see my review on Barcelo and you understand why. BUT if you prefer a quieter location, this may just be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ElaineC4
Reviews.Content: clean and tidy. room a little small but quiet hotel so that was good. walk ing distance from La Ramla.tour bus passes hotel but bit of a walk to La Ramla but close to main shopping street.Very close to a flamingo dance show which was good. beautiful hotel and quiet restaurant/bar. book directly with hotel may cost less. check out there website

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexMT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Barcelona Center Hotel. The hotel was spotless, modern, the room was spacious enough, and the bathroom was very large. Our room was overlooking the "backyard" (not the street), so it was very quiet. Housekeeping was good and consistent. Pleasant place to go back to after a day of sightseeing. There is a roof bar and jacuzzi with splendid views of the city. The location is unbeatable, walking distance to the Bus Touristic stop, Casa Batllo, La Pedrera. Away from the noisy touristic part of town with the typical junk stands and tourist traps. In the area of the hotel there were lots of nice cafes and restaurants (don't miss Cerveceria Catalana for lunch or dinner and cafe 5J for breakfast). If I go again to Barcelona, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “If the staff were friendlier and they removed the waterproof mattress protectors it would have been perfect.”
Reviews.Author: homeozzie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Center was convenient and had every convenience and facility that could be hoped for in this price hotel. But the reception staff were downright unfriendly and unhelpful and seemed not to like tourists at all. They seemed to be getting on well enough with the locals. The beds were terrific but they were covered with waterproof mattress protectors that were hot and uncomfortable despite the airconditioning. Other than these two things the hotel was great. A nice restaurant and a great breakfast restaurant. A small pool thing for relaxing by and a perfectly quiet room with no traffic or outside noise and no hotel noise. An easy walk to the main centres and near a bust stop and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: CapeCoralTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at this hotel and were overall pleased. A couple problems on ckecking in but the staff was very interested in making us comfortable. The room was comfortable and the hotel is close to Las Ramblas and also the underground. The front desk made some recommendations on dining and some were great and some not so much. Cafe' Catalunya down the street is a must. We ate dinner there twice and breakfast once. There is always a long wait for dinner so put your name in early. What we did was put our name in on the way back to the hotel and had plenty of time to shower and change before heading back(usually 1 hour wait). We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable hotel within walking distance to Las Ramblas. One more thing, we did not try the breakfast buffet only because we felt it was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TXman78
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the beginning of July, bookede through their website. I think the price was very good considering the hotel rooms, the staff, and location. The rooms were very comfortable, modern bathroom, it had a safe, good A/C which is important in the middle of summer. We didn't go in the spa on the top floor on the hotel but we did go up there. Great views and places to get some sun. There was construction going on in front of the hotel, but the windows have to be somewhat soundproofed b/c we didn't hear a thing. The staff was very friendly, spoke great english. Accommadated to all of our needs. I thought the location was great because we were in walking distance to "la Rambla" or the main strip in barcelona, but we were also far enough away not to be disturbed at night. If you wanted to hit up the beach, a short cab ride got u there. But be careful when you leave the beach, cause if you look like you just got out of the water, cabby's won't pick you up! Buses aren't my thing, but you might try it. The best Tapas we ate in Barcelona were 2 blocks from the hotel: Cerveseria Catalana. Some other reviewers have pics of it. Def ask the front desk about it but it is on the corner of Mallorca and rambla de Catalunya (las Ramblas). Also do the cable car ride near the marinas. You get to see Barcelona in a cool way. FYI: Don't go to Madrid. Spent 3 days there, waste of time, horrible food, not very friendly especially if you don't speak spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LLBDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 nights. We enjoyed Barcelona and plan to return someday and when we do, we will stay in this hotel again. We traveled with a our daughter and another couple and everyone was very pleased with the room and the hotel. The rooms were beautifully decorated, large and comfortable. We have spent a lot of time in Europe and this was definitely a pleasant surprise. We had numerous delays with our flight so we didn't arrive until about 2 am. We opted to bring our daughter at the last minute and the staff was very accommodating in bringing in an extra bed so late in the night when housekeeping had shut down. The next morning, they found a larger room for us that accommodated the extra bed easily. The room they gave us had a huge walk-in closet which worked out really well for all of our suitcases. The location was great, very clean and a lot of restaurants and shops to visit on the main shopping streets. We easily walked to the Las Rumblas area, which was a great area to visit but we were glad that we didn't choose a hotel in that area. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona based on our experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value - recommended”
Reviews.Author: GSMNorthernNJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location of Barcelona slightly off the very busy streets that seem to overtake this city which can be very hectic. We found the location desirable to walk to nearby venues. Their are plenty of restaurants within blocks of this location. I'm glad we didn't stay in the La Ramblas area, so by selecting this hotel, we were well located within around a 20 minute walk of many areas we wanted to visit. Also, the tourist double decker bus stopped a few blocks away which we found to be a desirable and convenient way to navigate this city. The hotel itself was well maintained, although we had a problem with the bathroom sink being backed up. However, they promptly attended to the problem, although it took two attempts to correct it. The front desk was very helpful in assisting us for various reasons - recommendations for locations to visit, directions, etc. The rooms had nice space both in the room and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: daisy2Ireland
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel was in a perfect location. it was near the passeig de gracia near the shops but it was a quiet and relaxing away form hustle and bustle of la ramblas. the room was spacious and clean. the curtains and dark interiors made for a perfect nights sleep. the staff were friendly but could have been better- a more relaxed approach. We asked them to recommend a restaurant but the ones recommended were not good! use trip advisor recommended restaurants! the terrace on the top floor is lovely and it was great to go up there at night and relax looking out over barcelona! overall hotel was clean and would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Quiet and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nyc1963
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights there. We initially wanted to stayed close to the Rambla but glad we picked this hotel because of the location was in a quiet residential area away from the noise. The outside looked like a luxury hotel but more boutique inside. The front desk staffs were okay (the male staffs were warmer though). The decor was more or less standard of any boutique hotels. Our room looked out to the back facing other residential buildings. However, it was quite sunny and we managed to dry our laundry within an hour! We enjoyed the walk from the hotel down to the Central Plaza and the Rambla. Walking back even after midnight felt very safe. There was a very lively tapas bar just a block away - Cerveceria Catalana, which was very hard to get a table but if you go around 7:00 pm you may get a table. One thing we realized was that there was a lot of Philipinos now working in tapas bars which really helped since they also spoke great English. Overall this hotel is perfect for short or long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Piney69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in June 09. The front desk was welcoming and took time to recommend areas of the city to visit. Rooms were large, clean and well-appointed with free wired internet access. Bedrooms have thick curtains and decent soundproofing which are important in this noisy city; however, the rumbling of the metro may upset light sleepers. We didn't use the restaurant and, like others, recommend the Cervecaria Catalunya just down the road. The roofbar was expensive but a nice diversion. The hotel is well-positioned to explore most areas of this (over-rated) city on foot. An excellent value hotel in a city where it is hard to find a good hotel for less than 100 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Room great, but reception staff a bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: BA279
Reviews.Content: We booked here after the great reviews here on TripAdvisor. Myself and my partner are a same sex couple, but not overtly so by any stretch of the imagination. We were both made to feel pretty awkward on check in by the receptionist who kept laboring the issue of whether we wanted two single beds or a double bed, and then seemed perplexed when we asked for a double, so much so as to ask again "are you sure". To be honest, I'm fairly used to this, but would love to go to a hotel where I'm not made to feel so cringeworthily embarrassed. For a 4 star hotel in a gay area of a cosmopolitan city, I must admit I expected a lot better. The room, however, was lovely. When first sitting on the bed, I was concerned about how hard it was. However, when sleeping, I don't think I've ever had such a comfortable sleep ever. I definitely wanted to take that mattress home! Staff in the wonderful rooftop terrace, as well as the chambermaids were exceptionally friendly, which made up for the rude gentleman on the front desk! The hotel is closest to the Provenca metro stop, but as this line isn't that well connected, we tended to use Diagonal which is about 2 minutes walk away. The Cerveseria Catalana is absolutely wonderful, and not overpriced at all. We ate there at least twice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: MagnumSauna
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel in the eixample. The staff is a little bit cool, but they changed my room without a problem when I asked for an outside one on a higher floor. The rate was really good and averaged about 100 euros over the weekend per night. The room is gorgeous if not extremely large. There is some roadwork outside the hotel currently, so if you are a late sleeper, you might want to ask them, also, the Balmes side gets a lot of traffic so you might want to get a room on Mallorca street. Otherwise, you are just minutes from passeig de Gracia, Rambla catalunya, plaza catalunya and the gay district. Another great think is the roof terrace with two jacuzzis. It was a bit cold when we were there, but even just having a drink there was marvelous as the sun went down over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wanderful staffs and grate room !”
Reviews.Author: mokoDouglas
Reviews.Content: 家族3人で3泊しました。まず、部屋まで荷物を運んでくれたスタッフが、とてもサービス精神に溢れていて、１人で３人分の荷物を持ち部屋まで案内してくれました。そして通された部屋の美しさに私たちはとても感激しました。部屋はとても広くモダンなデザインで、特に大きなキングベッドと素敵な照明が気に入りました。もちろんバスルームも広く、大理石で覆われていてとても奇麗です。玄関も広いので３人分のスーツケースを置いても狭いと感じませんでした。私たちはこの素敵なホテルを満喫するため、昼間は屋上のプールへ行ったり、プールサイドのバーでゆったりとした時間をすごしました。外出時には、スタッフの方がお勧めの観光スポットや交通機関を教えてくれ、とても効率的に時間を割くことができました。またバルセロナに来たら是非予約しようと思います。

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, stylish, and better price than competition”
Reviews.Author: Floorhead
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel with stylish rooms. Staff were very friendly and helpful (which is not always the case in Spain). The location is very central with easy access to the metro, train stations, and there are always taxis around. The rooms are very large by European standards, and the bathroom we had was massive. Everything is clean and well maintained. I did not eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. I was very happy with my stay and will be going back. Finally, the price was better than other 4* hotels in the area; and knowing a few of them I would say the quality is the same. Barcelona is notoriously expensive for hotels. The cons (both minor): 1. The sink in our room gurgled when the toilet was flushed or we used the shower. It only lasted for 10 seconds each time, but was quite loud sometimes. 2. One of the jaccuzi tubs on the roof was out of commission, and the other one had cold water in it. The "fabulous views" from the rooftop bar/restaurant/jacuzzi are a bit of an oversell - you can't really see much. If you want to relax, go to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay without hitches”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee079
Reviews.Content: Read many of the reviews on Tripadviser before booking. Got very good rate on hotel's website. Everything was as expected. Room (on 5th floor) was pleasant, spotlessly clean with huge bed and flat screen TV. Bathroom was also large with shower over bath and separate shower. As previous reviewers have said, room look like they do on website. Although hotel suggests towel re-use in practice towels were changed daily even if we left them on towel rails. It is disappointing not to have tea and coffee making facilities but we were aware of that and took travel kettle. Reception staff were helpful and polite rather than chatty. The man who checked us in recommmended Cerveceria Catalana (which is fantastic, has a great atmosphere and is definitely worth a visit) but be warned.. in the evening it's usually a 45 to 60 minute wait. Best to do as we did and put your name on the list and then come back at the recommmended time. The area is a little further out of the old centre than I thought but feels really safe and pleasant. The safe in the room is useful as we had heard the stories of the pickpockets too. Somebody on the flight home stayed just off La Rambla and felt quite threatened at night. All in all a pleasant stay in a lovely city with unexpectedly good weather. Do take the tour of the Palau de La Musica. The concert hall is amazing. If you visit La Sagrada Familia the audioguide makes all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “ask where the room is looking”
Reviews.Author: blueberryIstanbul
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights in center hotel (26-28 april). the price was ok comparing to the quality. room was very dressy, clean and wide. but the reception was very rude and unable to serve us properly. they did not even smile to us. we arrived about 12:30 in the afternoon. they gave us a room that was looking inside. it was like a grave. when we talked to the reception they hardly answered us and changed our room. the second room was not really different than the first one, slightly better. ı was suprised taht although they had a better room (even slightly better) they did not gave us at the begining. ı explained that we did the reservation one mouth ago so we want a better room with street view. their explanation was we arrieved early so we should get the room they gave us or we should wait 2 hours. after waiting we got a room looking to mallorca street. the problem was they did not explain us that the nicer rooms was full and gave us the worst room in the hotel. ı think they tried to get ride of that room immediately. what they should do was explaining us the alternatives. a room immediately or a better room after 2 hours. the porters were very nice and helpful. ı wish thay were the receptionist. but do not hesistate to choose that hotel. very calm, clean and very near to all facilities in barcelona. and finnally never come back witout eating a dinner at cerveseria cataluna. worth for waiting. delicious and very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: passionlily
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable but don't expect tea/coffee facilities in the room - which was a big disappointment when you like a cup first thing in the morning! The bathroom is large in comparison to the room but nice and you can have clean towels daily if you want but they do ask you to reuse. Reception desk is very small, and the receptionists were a bit dour and rude on occasion. The porters were friendly and always greeted you with a smile and very helpful. Don't expect to get a meal before 8.30pm - we were told 'the kitchen is closed'.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: kruzingtogether
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a great boutique. The service is great, and rooms are spacious, modern, and clean. The hotel also has a roof-top bar with hot tubs and a great view of the city. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood, but is right by La Cerveceria (which has amazing tapas) and is a short walk from Las Ramblas. We loved our stay here and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.... Nothing bad to say...”
Reviews.Author: FClaessen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reviewing some of the comments on Tripadvisor. My girlfriend and I spend 3 nights and must say that it certainly met our standards. After a very friendly welcome by the receptionist whom handed over the card keys to our room immediately, despite the fact we arrived early (10:30 in the morning). The room looked exactly as on the pictures you find on their website. Very nice, tidy and all comfort you expect in a four star hotel (LCD TV, built in wardrobe, decent size bathroom…). I would recommend the €9.90 for pay-movies, internet, etc… a real bargain! The location is excellent with many restaurants in the area and a 10 minute walk to the Plaça Catalunya and the famous “Rambla”. We didn’t ate in the hotel restaurant but had a few drinks served by very professional and friendly waiters. No negative remarks for the hotel; we will be back there without any doubt... One word of advice: if you go out for food in a restaurant, double check the bill. They tried on two occasions to charge us more and unfortunately I only saw it the first time; the second time I checked the bill after I paid. And it was not in a “tourist trap” restaurant but near the yacht harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Really Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunlady88
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from a 3 day break in barcelona. we got a taxi from airport for 30 euros and the driver was so good pointing out all the good plaxes to see and even eat! the hotel is in a great park of town but the traffic needs getting used to. the breakfast that was included was really great, they had a great selection of bith hot and cold foods and the staff were really friendly. didn't get a chance to use the hot tubs on the roof of the hotel mostly due to lack of time! they were also making repairs. i was worried coming to barcelona because of the stories i had heard,pickpockets ect but luckily we never once felt neasy, also i avoided bringing my handbag out at all whilst we were here, everything i needed i could fit into my pockets! i highly recommend the barcelona bus trips, we did a one day package for 21 euro's each and was great! I myself don't have the slightest interest in football but we did go to fcb grounds and it was really amazing! highly recommond a trip to the hardrock cafe in la rambles the food is great but a little on the pricy side. Over all barcelona is a really great city to visit and im sure i will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JP10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in the Center Hotel mid March, and liked it very much. It's in a convenient (and safe feeling) area about 5 mins from shops and restaurants on Passeig de Gracia and about 20mins from the Ramblas. We had a front room on the 4th floor overlooking the intersection. The room was large and comfortable with a king sized double bed. The en-suite was also large with a full sized bath with shower over. All bedroom and bathroom fittings were pretty new, in good condition and very clean. There was a safe in the room which was useful to keep valuables and spare cash to avoid taking it all with you every day, especially useful considering all the pick-pocket warnings about Barcelona (although luckily we didn’t feel particularly threatened at any time while we were there). Breakfast was included in our deal and there was a good selection of cold and hot dishes, our favourite being scrambled eggs on toast. We also had evening meal at the hotel on our first night, being rather tired after a 4am start and a long afternoon sightseeing, so it was nice to be able to go down to the bar, have a few drinks and eat well on the premises. The fixed price menu was about €18 for 3 courses, with a choice of 5-6 dishes for each course, which we thought was good value for the choice and quality on offer. We tried out the Jacuzzi and sauna a few times which was refreshing after day’s sightseeing. All in all a comfortable, clean, safe hotel with good food and service. Tips: We used the train from the airport. Passeig de Gracia station on the RENFE airport line is the nearest to the hotel. The station exit is at the intersection with C/Arago, alongside Gaudi's Casa Battlo about 10mins walk to the hotel. Note If you use the airport bus and then change to the metro, the Passeig de Gracia METRO station is further south, nearer the Ramblas so is not so convenient. The nearest Metro station to the hotel would be Diagonal. On the return to the airport the trains depart every 30 mins from Passeig de Gracia platform 1, at 2 mins and 32 mins past the hour (March 2009), journey time about 25 -30 mins. Great tapas close to the hotel at Cerveceria Catalan on C/ Mallorca - a lucky find for our first lunch straight after checking in. Also it's worth trying the menu de dias in restaurants in the old town. We tried two and enjoyed a 3 course lunch including wine for €9 each. We chose them on the basis they were busy with locals and the menus were only in Spanish, (so not tourist traps) and with some help from our dictionary we were rewarded with excellent meals.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mesaswife
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It was extremely well furnished & decorated to a high standard. The room was larger than average- I have stayed in a few!!-with a flat screen tv which also gave internet access for 8 euros per 24 hours, otherwise if you take your own laptop the internet was free. The only negative was there was no tea & coffee making facilities in our room. The bathroom was huge- with double glass doors leading to the bath with shower over, as well as another shower beside it. The reception staff were very friendly & approachable, as were the bar staff. Our first night we decided to eat in the restaurant, and the set winter menu -3 courses with plenty of choice- was only 16.95 euros excl tax. Had we had more time we most certainly would have ate there again. it was about a 10 minute walk down Calles de Balmes to Placa Catalunya, where you could walk down Las Ramblas or take one of the tour buses around the city. One note of caution though, both the blue line (south) & red line (north) do not always stop directly close to many of the must-see sights, most were a 10 -20 minute walk from the nearest stop. All in all I would return to Barcelona & would stay in this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely furnished, not so great view”
Reviews.Author: eowyngirl
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice little hotel, well deserved 4 stars. Richly furnished but not so opulent that you would mistake it for a 5 star. Most encouraging was that the room I got looked EXACTLY like it did in the pictures on the website - very encouraging indeed! Nice and convenient location for anyone who doesn't want to be amongst the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas; it can get really rowdy around there so L'Exiample was a great place for me. Anyone with heaps of luggage will find it a struggle if you're hiking from the nearest Metro station (Passeig de Gracia) as HBC is a goodly few blocks from there. Staff were attentive and very helpful, no problems with leaving my bags before and after my stay. The only gripes I had were that the reception wasn't always tended, especially at night. Not sure where all the staff went but they were nowhere near the lobby. Also I had no view from my room which was a great pity as the rest of the hotel and furnishings were so nicely done - although suspect this was b/c I booked through as a cheaper rate / single traveller using a double room! (the window looked out onto a brick wall that was about three feet away from it!).

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: IanMitchell
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent! My partner, baby and I stayed for two nights. Very clean, very luxurious. It is in a great location, just round the corner from Las Ramblas, they setup a cot and made it both days even though we brought our own. No microwave or kettle in the room but the staff were more than happy to fill the baby bottles with boiled water so that was no problem at-all. Very nice and helpful staff. You will be surprised for the cost, it cost us just 150 euros for the two nights, I booked with Lastminute.com The Tapas bar around the corner was fabulous! It is a "must" I forget the name but it begins with a C as I remember, as the very helpful reception staff. Another "must" is the tour bus, take this as soon as you can for an excellent view of this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel--evenb etter than expected!”
Reviews.Author: thekma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel and were very impressed. We arrived late only to discover there had been some legitimate linguistic confusion over the room. We had emailed the hotel asking for a regular room with a cot for our seven year old. The English receptionist on duty seemed surprised that we had asked for a cot for our daughter, gently hinting that she thought we needed a bigger room and that our daughter was a "little big for a cot." We replied that, no, she always sleeps on cots when we are in hotel rooms. Eventually, we learned that for Brits cot means "crib" and not simple foldaway bed! Anyway, she and the other attendant decided that the standard room would be a bit cramp[ed with a foldaway bed and they upgraded us to a beautiful suite on the 5th floor, replete with balcony-type windows....all for the 80 euros a night price we had secured via the hotel website. The room was tastefully decorated and well serviced by the cleaning crew. Though the room faced the intersection, it was incredibly quiet--we did not even feel the subway rumble that some readers mentioned. I think the only negative thing was that the hot tub/jacuzzi was broken while we were there (they are waiting for a part to be shipped in order to repiar it), but that was a very minor disappointment, as there are lots of other things to bve doing in Barcelona! We didn't eat in the hotel, but rather took the desk attendant's recommendations and went to the two tapas places they recokmmended (one was a half block away on Via Mallorca and was always busy--we ate our breakfasts there and were very happy) and the other was 2 and a half blocks away and was terrific. Unfortunately, I cannot recall the names. But they steered us very well. The hotel is in an excellent location--an easy 5 minute walk to Gaudy's celebrated apartment building, not too far from a subway stop, etc. The neighborhood is mixed, residential and business and there are restaurants, cafes, grocery stores and everythign else you could want just down the block. But is it in a sanity zone in terms of noise. All in all, this was a fantastic place to stay and we will be going to this hotel again...the "regular" rooms looked nice, as well!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AusBCN
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very clean, well appointed. Got a good last minute deal from ratestogo.com (80 euros ++). Our room was interior so very quiet except for the occasional distant rumble from the metro trains far beneath the building. We arrived early (12pm), they handled the early checkin very well. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room - skip the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jbee832
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor when the Hotel Villa Emilia cancelled on us with only 3 days notice (boo hiss). We only had the one night in the hotel in a standard room. It was decent sized room and looked good. The hotel was in a great location. The reception staff were attentive and helpful. We left our bags with them on the Sunday morning while we did a Segway tour (www.spainglides.com) which was excellent fun. My only gripe would be the breakfast - for some reason we thought breakfast was included but it wasn't. The hot food was cold and the selection wasn't great, so a bill of an extra 17e per person wasn't greatly appreciated. Our mistake but a costly one!

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: MTLMidlands_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Loved the luxury in the hotel -receptionists need some attention though! We stayed here for a 4 day tour of Barcelona. Booked the hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor and they were generally bang on .Magnificent bedroom, really spotless and beautifully furnished.Breakfast was steep at 17e extra each so we ate in a really nice tapas bar 20 metres down the street. Room service excellent. It is in a very nice district ,if a little far away, maybe 15 mins walk to the La Rambla hive of activity. We had pretty wet cold weather so we soon got used to using the metro to travel from the hotel to the main attractions just 2 stops away.If I were going again I think I would rather compromise on the luxury to get a more central location.There's so much to see! The only gripe I have about this hotel is the reception. The evening we arrived the receptionist could not locate our booking .When I showed her our copy which I had printed out from the website she sighed and agreed that it would be okay because there was plenty of availability anyway.There was definitely no sign of a remotely friendly welcome. Again on our departure we were coldly sent on our way . When we returned later to get our bags we again encountered the same dismissive attitude. Nevertheless if you want real luxury, huge firm beds, comfy surroundings and fabulous food go for it - just ignore the lack of friendliness !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Break”
Reviews.Author: Joolzief
