Reviews.Content: After much reading and research I booked the Barcelona Center for a 3 night break for my partners 40th birthday. I chose the hotel for its location, rating and cost. We were both delighted with the hotel, room and facilities. It was calm, peaceful and very comfortable. We had a lovely big room on the 5th floor overlooking the Calle des Balmes with a little balcony and floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was fabulous with a separate bath and wet room. The beds are firm but fine. The TV wasn't working properly and couldn't get music to listen to while getting ready to go out or when back in. Also no tea/coffee faclilties in the room which I would have liked. Breakfast was included in the deal (otherwise expensive). It had a variety of hot and cold food, great coffee, plenty fresh fruit and the usual breads and cereals etc. It is about a 10 minute walk/ 20 minute stroll from the Plaza Catalunya and the top end of the Ramblas. From the roof terrace you can see the Sagrada Familia (25 minute walk) and Mont Juic. Best parts for us are the Eixample cafes and bars for tapas etc. The Born/Sant Pere area for exploring and shopping.The Gothic quarter for strolling round and for a bit of an edgy experience the Lower Raval. We found ourselves in a street (Il Roberador) which was pretty grim and for me - on the wrong side of scary. We were warned to stay away by some random guy as we obviously stuck out like typical tourists. It was wall to wall prostitutes, dealers and users, not to mention the gangs (one guy banging some metal piping against the wall as we approached!). My heart was certainly racing a bit. However we survived and a bit of sense and caution is advised. We loved Barcelona. What a great place. The Aerobus is a little over 4 euros to the City Centre. A taxi about 21 Euros (including 1 case and a supplement of 3 Euros). The Tourist bus is a great way to see other parts of the City which you can hop on and off and change routes (red and blue). The Nou Camp (17 euros is well worth a visit). But the best way is to walk and sit in pavement cafes with some Cava and Tapas (weather permitting).

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: trp_advsr_mmbr
Reviews.Content: I trawled through the reviews on Tripadvisor before picking this hotel and all the positive accounts are bang on. We loved this hotel. We were travelling with our one-year old so we needed a cot in the room. On arrival we were informed that the cot was in place and we'd been given an upgrade to allow us more space. Everything about this hotel made it the perfect choice for a break in Barcelona. The food is delicious, the rooms spacious and comfortable, the staff all have excellent English and are exceptionally pleasant and helpful. Loved it, stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: jemr
Reviews.Content: I booked the Center Hotel having read the reviews on this site and was very glad I had. We have stayed in Barcelona a number of times and the hotel was slightly more than we usually pay but still good value. The room was modern, comfortable and well furnished (yes, the beds are firm but I think that's a good thing and there is a pillow menu). The bathroom was large and clean, the service was courteous and there is a lovely roof terrace where were able to enjoy an evening drink. We didn't try the restaurant as there are many good (and inexpensive) restuarants in the surrounding side streets and we found an excellent baker/patisserie for breakfast. The hotel is situated near the top end of the Passeig de Gracia, with its great shops, and about 10 minutes walk from the Placa Catalunya and well away from the touristy Ramblas (but this too is walkable). Others have commented on the noise from the subway and there is indeed a distant rumble but this didn't disturb us at all. I thoroughly recommend the Center Hotel for a top class weekend at a reasonable price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Location and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: digtravel
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Barcelona Center, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Highlights would be the comfortable, quiet rooms with great darkening shades; the fantastic breakfast buffet; great location near the sites but off the main drag; free wifi in the lobby and roof deck access. Service was generally top notch, especially Jordi, one of the main clerks there. Breakfast included hot entrees, great coffee and many choices. The roof top deck was lovely, I wish only that the hot tub was a little hotter. All in all, a great stay at a high quality hotel1

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: zukoto
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and perfect location. Loved the top roof hydromassage jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: offroadinaj
Reviews.Content: Having never traveled outside US, I did not have any expectations really, (although reading other reviews prepared me for the small size of rooms!), but found this room quite nice! was probably the largest of all rooms stayed at during trip even. The bathroom was downright luxurious compared to others as well! Beds seem to be very hard as a standard everywhere we stayed, and these were no exception. Free internet access was nice bonus. The area is definately quiet at night, a bit away from everything. We took the bus from the airport, as suggested on other reviews, but is was a bit longer of a walk, slightly uphill, than expected. still, not a problem if you like to walk. We used the metro to get around town after that. Walked to Las Ramblas. Thought it was a good value for money, would stay again-

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a staff team with a can-do attitude”
Reviews.Author: MarkLondon34
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nigths here, and was very impressed with this hotel. The room was modern, comfortable and soundproofed. The room service was efficient and reasonably priced. The staff were friendly and had a brilliant attitude. They gave me access to a computer and I was able to print my boarding pass free of charge. Every other hotel I stayed in charged me for this! The hotel is in a fantastic location, I thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless in all areas”
Reviews.Author: tonyb5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a long weekend to celebrate an anniversary. Really impressed with the cleanliness of the whole hotel and the friendly nature of the staff. English speaking staff an added luxury and a privilege as you are in their country. Staff willing to point you to various points of interest and assist in making your stay enjoyable. Our room was very comfortable despite the dark decor. Spoilt fr choice with the buffet breakfast in a lovely bright dining area. The restaurant was worth a visit as well. I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Must go to Cerveseria Catalunya down the street!!”
Reviews.Author: msandico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in July and were nicely impressed with the hotel. Clean room, big bathrooms with granite but i think for the price we paid, it could have been a little better/grander. Service was decent and the location is 2 streets away from Placia de Gracia but at the top end. So if you want to go down to the main La Rambla, its about a 10-15 minute walk and even further to get to the waterfront. The BEST part about this is its very close proximity to the BEST tapas bar around, Cerveseria Catalunya. The service was excellent and the tapas were so delicious. Beware howevere, that this place is very popular and can take a while to get a seat. When we go back to BCN, we are defintely coming here..and maybe the Center Hotel though i'd like to be by the beachfront next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, well recommended”
Reviews.Author: shinney
Reviews.Content: Myself, my partner and our 10 month old daughter stayed in this hotel for 8 nights in May and found it great although there were some minus points. The location was great, about 10 minutes walk from the ramblas, in a quiet area which we found quite safe, there was a nice very reasonable Chinese two or three blocks down on the way to the ramblas on the right and also a great Irish bar nearby , Scobies, if thats what you are into. The hotel itself was very nice, our room which was on the third floor was very spacious with lots of storage space and a large bathroom. We requested that there was a cot placed in the room and there was a travel cot set up and ready for us when we arrived. The rooms were cleaned every morning. I didn't find any noise issue with either traffic or trains. The hotel breakfast was lovely, with plenty of fruit, pastries, breads, eggs cooked two ways, meat and cheese. Our daughter loved the fruit and cheeses. However if it wasn't included in our room price i don't think I would have paid 17 euros for it. I also found the staff in the hotel fantastic, especially the porter who took our bags to the room, spread a map on the bed and spent ages showing us the sights of Barcelona. The reception staff were also great and always friendly and willing to help. As a hotel for a baby it was great as they were very welcoming and eager to help and also talk to our daughter. There were however a couple of minus points, we ate in the hotel restaurant one night and i wouldn't recommend it, there wasn't much food served and what there was wasn't great. The staff in the bar and restaurant were also quite abrupt and unfriendly which was a contrast to the other staff we encountered. There are much better places nearby. Also internet access in the lobby was only available if you had your own laptop as the computer in the lobby was always used for meetings. Finally unfortunately the jacuzzi was closed for maintenance for most of our stay but the night we got in them was fab. Sorry this review was so long but it includes the things i would like to hear. Definitely give this hotel a go. We found it great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wildsnoopster
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We stayed on the 6th floor and found it very comfortable. The only complaint I would have is that we had a twin room rather than a double. We used the jacuzzi on the roof which was excellent and although we did not use the gym it looked in good nick and would suit most people. The hotel is situated on Carrer de Balmes at the junction with Carrer De Mallorca a few minutes from La Ramblas and it is just off the shopping strip. It is ideal for everything within the metropolitan areas of Barcelona unless you have to be in the middle of everything. It is 5 minutes from the nearest metro station which is very reliable and safe. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone it is clean, safe, good location and the staff are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: charm8
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room at the Barcelona Center Hotel. It was beautifully decorated and located on the fifth floor (away from traffic noise) with a lovely view of the street below. The hotel is located within walking distance of La Rambla with easy access to public transportation and tour buses. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our only disappointment was the main dining room where we had an expensive dinner with poor service and almost inedible food. However, there are many other restaurants close by. Keeping that in mind, we would stay here again on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with unconfortable bed and pillows.”
Reviews.Author: Winelover37
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed 5 days at the Barcelona Center Hotel in May 2008. The location is great as is it near to many Gaudi projects, to the Gracia Street for shopping, and to many good restaurants. We found an excellent tapas restaurant on Mallorca two blocks for the hotel, where we had beakfeat each morning and came back sometime for lunch around 2:30 pm. The hotel itsef was recently renovated. We had an amazing suite, with a big balcony where we could see the city. But, the king sized bed was very hard and the foam pillows were very unconfortable; we did not sleep well. This is the reason why we would not recommend it and why it does merit its four star status. The housekeeping was very slow; on the first day, we only had our room only at 3:00 pm, and then, our room was usualy not cleaned when we came back aroud 2:30. Sometime, they came back at night, sometime they did not. At the front office, the service was good even if it was not that organized. This would be a great hotel if they would improve their beds and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTed
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night as we had just returned from Seville and were flying back to the States the following day. After having stayed in another, more "modest" hotel in Barcelona the week prior, we wanted to splurge and booked this hotel for our last night in Spain. We picked this hotel based in part on location and reviews and made the reservation 1 week prior to arrival(although I was really hoping to get a room at Hotel Puitzer but it was booked due to the last minute nature of our reservations). Regardless, we weren't disappointed with this hotel. Getting there: Having used the metro and aeroport bus on our first trip to barcelona, we decided to take the taxi this time (23 euros for 4 people w/ luggage). The return trip to the airport via taxi for 2 of us was 24 euros (more traffic). You can also take the aeroport bus (~ 2euros) from the airport (buy the tickets when you board) to the center of the city at Plaza Catalunya and then take the metro (L3/Green Line) towards the Diagonal stop (2 stops down) for ~1 euro per person (would definitely recommend buying a T10 pass for the metro if you plan on being there for a few days as you can use the pass 10 times for multiple passengers and it only costs 7.5 euros). The Hotel is about 2 blocks from th metro stop Diagonal. The Hotel: Although check-in is at 1pm, our rooms were not ready for some reason at 3pm when we arrived and we were told to wait or walk around until it was available. My friend was able to convince them to comp us for free drinks and sandwiches in their cafe while we waited another 15mins. The room it itself was very nice for $247 after taxes/night. We had 2 twin beds pushed together instead of a double "since they were full." The same happened to my friend and his wife as well. Not a big deal though. There was a large LCD TV w/ the option of having access to the all their movies and internet for 20 euros/day. The bathroom was also very nice but did not have a shower curtain (a theme we noticed throughout spain), so we had to be careful about getting water on the floor. As for amenities, the hotel had a small work out room (treadmill, stationary bike, and row machine), sauna, as well as 2 outdoor hot tubs on the roof which we definitely took advantage of. The staff was friendly and helpful as well (to be expected in a 4star hotel). Location: Nice location that was within walking distance of Las Ramblas (~15mins). Also within 2 blocks of the Metro stop (Diagonal). Downside is that it's right over the metro/train and you can hear them rumble when eating in the cafe. We were on the 5th floor but could still hear a faint rumble (not bothersome at all). Overall, would recommend this hotel given it's nice atmosphere and convenient location to several restaurants and shopping areas nearby. My wife and friends enjoyed it quite a bit but I might consider staying at Hotel Casa Furster (sp?) next time as I preferred it's location and it seemed nicer from the outside. It was a bit more pricier at 187 euro/night (even with a "special promotional rate) though. I also was hoping to stay at Hotel Pulitzer but it was booked by the time I made this reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: world_traveler0406
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal (100 Euro a night) on this hotel! It was worth more than that! The front desk was always helpful no matter what we asked. They gave a great suggestion for a flamenco show that we absolutely loved! The area felt safe and we had no problems with anything. We booked the hotel after the good reviews it got on here and were happy with our 4-night stay there! Their service was super! The only complaint was that the restaurant (which we ate in because of poor weather one night) was not smoke-free. Above everything else, the location was amazing! We were able to walk everywhere. The port is probably the furthest, but it was not a bad walk at all! Excellent hotel and well worth staying there, even if it were for location alone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - If You Can Get a Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: Frecuente-T
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel to stay -- if you can get a good rate (we did, booking online through Expedia.com, average of EUR 135 per night including all taxes and charges). Close to metro stations (Diagonal, Passeig de Gracia). Hotel room on 4th floor was quiet (ask for room facing interior), spotlessly clean. Staff were very helpful. Did not eat at hotel, and no need, since good local restaurants for dinner and early opening bars for breakfast nearby. Minor problems were of the plumbing nature: water would not run out of sinks, and rooftop jacuzzi was cold. But not big issues. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Phirenice
Reviews.Content: PROs: The staff were helpful and friendly, the hotel was clean and nicely designed. The location is excellent, right next to Las Ramblas and you can get guides for the Bus Turistic at reception (you pay 3 euros and that gets taken off the full ticket price when you actually board the bus). CONs: The rather nifty bed pillows are long and sausage shaped, but they are so soft that when you lay your head on top of them, its as though they don't exist! There are some harder, square pillows hidden on the top shelf of the cupboards in the room, which are better than nothing but not wonderful. The bed itself is hard, but not so much that its uncomfortable. If you don't mind having a straight back, its fine. Breakfast is foul, its cheap, greasy stuff that you'd find in any budget hotel. The coffee is instant and not a pleasant experience. Breakfast was not included in our room price (you can choose to include it if you want). We tried it one day and had to pay 17 euros per person! Its a crime! I only wanted a bowl of cereal, but felt I had to fill up on something more substantial at that price. So avoid breakfast, find it somewhere else. CONCLUSION: Despite the cons above, I would actually recommend staying at this hotel because everything else about it is great. HINTS: You have to go to "Osmosis" a restaurant of contemporary Catalan cuisine about 2 blocks from the hotel. They open at 9pm and are on the corner of Aribau and Mallorca. The food is absolutely amazing, the service extremely attentive and helpful and.. well.. you just have to go! I found it after a few days of researching Barcelona restaurant reviews for somewhere that was relatively near the hotel, with consistently good reviews and that would offer some local specialities. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: traveller200802
Reviews.Content: Overall this was an excellent hotel. Front desk staff was superb in recommending restaurants, giving directions and understanding our urgency when we figured out we were late for our flight! Room and bathroom were both high end. Definitely has a boutique hotel feel even though it is quite large. Bar/restaurant and common areas were really unique in appearance. If a tourist, be prepared with your walking shoes though as the hotel is in a beautiful neighbourhood but at least a mile and a half to two away from gothic quarter/main areas etc. Its a great walk though, and if tired after a long day taxis were abundant. Definitely recommend Barcelona Center Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, stylish modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: trinasn_sy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through all the good reviews and so glad i booked it! The location is ideal, far enough from the crowds of Passaeig de Gracia and Rambla de Catalunya but close enough to walk to them ( 5-8 mins). The Diagonal metro station which is just near will take you to almost all places of interest, plus the bus stops just outside the hotel, route 17, and takes you through the city centre down to the port. Taxis are also just a wave away! The rooms offered great comfort in a modern setting. Our first room was smaller with a window on an inside atrium and was totally quiet. We had to change because of a heating problem and the second room was much more spacious but was directly by the street so it got quite noisy with the traffic (even with the triple glazing). But the nice bathroom and the special pillows you can choose make up for it. If you are sensitive to noise, then opt for an inside room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall, just great!

Reviews.Title: “Fab boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funtraveller007
Reviews.Content: We went for my 30th birthday, and had a fabulous time. The hotel is in a great position, being within walking distance of the main centre but in a quiet and attractive area of Barcelona and close to a taxi rank. The rooms were really well appointed, and had a massive bed, walk in drench room and beautiful marble bathroom. The breakfasts were absolutely fine. Our one suggestion would be to eat main meals in one of the many restaurants in the city, rather than the restuarant of the hotel as, oddly, it is still not no smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: bpc124
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after reading the good reviews on this site, and we were not disappointed. It was brilliant from reception, to room, to the fantastic rooftop jacuzzi which was perfect to unwind after a day walking round the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Desertgirl1960
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Barcelona Center Hotel for 4 nights during our 25th anniversary trip to Spain and Italy in Sept. 2007. We arrived at the hotel at about 11 a.m. and our room was ready which was a great relief since we flew all night and were exhausted. The hotel is located in the Eixample district - an easy 10 min. walk to the Placa de Catalunya, La Ramblas and the waterfront but away from all the noise and craziness of Las Ramblas. There were plenty of restaurants/bars/cafes nearby as well as shopping. The hotel is located on the corner of Calle Mallorca. We were never disturbed by outside noise or other guests. It was remarkably quiet which was great after long, exhausting days sightseeing. The room was perfect - it faced a very pretty courtyard and had clearly been recently remodeled. It was very clean and modern with a large flatscreen TV, a safe and 2 built-in wardrobes. The bathroom was spotless and the shower pressure and hot water was plentiful any time of day. The breakfast was included in our price. There was a good selection of foods, both hot and cold. The only thing we didn't care for was the very runny scrambled eggs (this seems to be the standard in Europe). We did not eat at the hotel restaurant. The hotel provided internet service. A little pricey but very convenient and it was always available when we wanted to use it. I didn't see any internet cafes on the street like there are in Rome but maybe we just weren't looking in the right places. We bought tickets for the hop-on hop-off open-air bus on the first day and it was a great way to familiarize ourselves with the city and get from place to place. We did not use the metro system. We did book a day trip to Torres Winery, Monserrat (a monastery in the mountains) and Sitges (a small town by the sea just south of Barcelona). The winery was about an hour outside of Barcelona and very nice. Monserrat sits high on a mountain and the views are breathtaking. The boys choir sings every day at 1 p.m. and was amazing to listen to. Sitges has alot of history and architecture and the beaches there were beautiful. I would highly recommend this day trip. All in all, the Barcelona Center Hotel was a great place to stay and if we ever return to Barcelona, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janna5864
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. Very friendly staff, clean rooms, convenient setting a short walk from the P' de gracia. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would book again when in Barcelona. It's walking distance from Las Ramblas and close to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beatles
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Hotel Barcelona Center in October 2007. The Hotel was lovely with everything you could need. The room was really lovely but it would be really nice if fellow travellers would take care when staying in the rooms. The dressing table had been marked by hot hair straighners we felt it was a reak shame as the Hotel had only been redecorated and refurbished. The location was great just off the ramblas but Barcelona itself is a great City to visit the tapas is addictive and the people are very friendly. We would definatley be going back to this hotel but the biggest wow factor were the two jacuzzi's on the roof overlooking the City. We were luck enough to have one each on our return from sight seeing one day. If you are going to Barcelona give this Hotel a visit its a must.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silverstate
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona in early November and stayed at this hotel. We found it to be very nice. The room was clean and quiet. The hotel is very centrally located and we could walk everywhere. There are plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood. It is a quick walk to Las Ramblas although we enjoyed Passeig de Gracia much more than Las Ramblas. We loved the breakfast. All in all a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hairyjock
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night break at this hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and in Barcelona. Our trip there and back (due a flight fiasco) is another story!!! The hotel is located in the Eixemple district about 10 minutes walk from the Placa de Catalunya and La Rambla. Nearby the hotel there is a wide range of bars, cafes and restuarants and some great designer shopping on the Passeig de Gracia. Our room was very comfortable and of a good size with a nice bathroom that had a great shower. Hotel also has a nice roof terrace with 2 hot tubs, seating, sun loungers and some great views over Barcelona. The staff at the hotel were all very courteous and most spoke good English. All the public areas of the hotel were spotlessly clean and had high quality fixtures and fittings. Buffet breakfast was good with a good choice that was well presented. Overall I would recommend this hotel to couples looking for a good hotel for a few days soaking in the sights and sounds of Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandTravel-lover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before a cruise and had picked this hotel because of reviews on tripadvisor. Very happy with the hotel. Modern, clean room. Breakfast was included and was very good. Would recommend the open top tourist bus for an easy way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: denverworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by accident and are so glad we did. We were staying in Barcelona over the Columbus Day national holiday and had difficulty finding a hotel. I stumbled onto this hotel, which was more than we wanted to pay. It turns out it was worth every cent. We loved the location. Away from all the congestion of the Las Ramblas area but close to some really great restaurants and the shopping on Gracia and Cataluna. It was more like staying in a neighborhood. The service was excellent, the rooms very comfortable. we really enjoyed our stay there and would definitely recommend it to others. They did have a computer where you could check e-mail at 5 Euros for an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, great location”
Reviews.Author: ghermesherver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our August bank holiday break, and it exceeded our expectations. For the price we paid, it was well worth it. Walking distance to the Passaig da Gracia or Diagonal metros (we took this one most of the time). Also within walking distances to a lot of cafes on Catalunya. I recommend a tapas place called Taller de Tapas (on Placa Catalunya or Passaig Catalunya, don't remember the name of the street). It's a bit trendy and pricey, but you get excellent service and excellent food. You don't have to dress trendy to go in - plenty of people in dark jeans there. No tshirts or shorts, though. We had breakfast included in our room rate - it was a good, hot breakfast - definitely worth eating there and leaving to start our day, rather than spending part of the morning hunting for a breakfast place (we did that one day when we missed the breakfast cutoff). Get there more than 30 min before they close, otherwise you may not get any scrambled eggs. Didn't eat at the restaurant. Didn't seem like anything special. The staff were curteous and spoke several languages including English (I spoke Spanish with them). The rooms were very clean, very well kept, just be careful with the bathroom floor, as water tends to splash out a bit and you can slip. Our room was 411 - facing the stret in front of the hotel, but not too noisy. Then again, I sleep with ear plugs all the time, so I don't get bothered much. We also went upstairs to the jacuzzis. The view is not spectacular, but it's nice to go up and relax for a bit during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiggyblue
Reviews.Content: Location - Excellent 5-10 mins from The Ramblas so central enough but without all the hassle. Rooms - Good quality fittings, very comfortable beds, blackout curtains and a peaceful atmosphere. Hotel amenities - Breakfast plentiful and a high standard, staff pleasant and helpful, jaccuzzis on the roof a bonus after a long day sightseeing. Thoroughly recommend this 4* hotel and if returning to the area would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible food!”
Reviews.Author: mikey543
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from staying at the Barcelona Center hotel and although the room was excellent and the staff were very polite the food supplied by the on-site restaurant was very poor. The restaurant menu was ok however once the food arrived one of our meals (chicken broquettes) was very UNDERCOOKED. At the same time we noticed another guest ask for their food to be recooked. The following night we had room service ordering a simple hamburger however after one bite it was clear the burger was RAW in the centre. (Still dripping with blood). This sort of thing could ruin someones holiday. Certainly none of the staff I asked would eat it. I very much hope that this was a one-off as the rest of the hotel was fantastic. (Location, staff, facilities etc.) Breakfast was fine so I can only assume that the chef in the evening wasn't a chef at all. However I wouldn't let this put people off going to Barcelona which is an excellent city with beautiful food, attractions, people and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bargain rate”
Reviews.Author: miss-figgy
Reviews.Content: We booked our four night stay as part of a package from lastminute and got a really good rate which worked out at about £100 per night RO. Not bad for a 4* in western Europe. The hotel is attractive and has plenty of facilities including jacuzzis on the roof terrace (lovely when the sun is out, not so hot when it's not) and a chic looking restaurant (that we did not try). The hotel is very contemporary with lots of orchids, marble and dark wood furniture. The room was smartly furnished and with plenty of room (we got moved from our first room as it was a twin and found that the double room was slightly bigger). Best of all was the bathroom which was massive (on a hotel bathroom scale). It was divided into the sink / toilet / bidet area, with a massive mirror and lots of marble and then a separate wet room with a bath. Linen was changed every other day and the bed was firm but comfy (with lots of spare pillows that were allegedly of different weights and fibres, but I didn't try them out so can't say). Annoyingly the massive framed pictures above the desk were crooked and couldn't be straightened, but this was only a minor niggle. Reception are not terribly friendly - it was unusual to get greeted when you came in and out of reception - but if you needed help they were fine (good for restaurant reservations). Location is not perfect but this is down to Barcelona's geography - the city is laid out in a long strip. To walk to Las Ramblas (the other side of Placa Catalunya) takes about 20 minutes, Barceloneta and the beach a further 20 or 30 minutes (depending on how busy Las Ramblas was, which was largely dependant on the number of people pretending to be statues. Quite why people find this so entertaining it beyond me, but there seemed to be a lot of them there so there must be some money in it!). We spent a lot of time in the Eixample (there are some excellent restaurants there and the area is less touristy than Las Ramblas) and the hotel is perfect for this. It's also well located for Casa Mila and Casa Batllo/Manzana Discordia as well as lots of designers stores and boutiques. The Barcelona metro system is pretty poor so try not to rely on it too much - there are two systems and although your ticket will work in both you will need to use two credits if you want to use them both. Also if you have to change systems it's a very, very long walk between platforms. If you do stay at the hotel and don't want to walk everywhere walk one street up Carrer Balmes and take the metro (any S route) from Provenca down to Placa Catalunya. Most of southern Barcelona is within walking distance of this stop. Either that or walk to Passeig De Gracia or Diagonal and take the L3 or 4 to Barceloneta or Jaumes. When arriving from the airport if you catch the airport bus take the metro from the North West corner of Placa Catalunya and get the metro just one stop to Provenca and save yourself what seems like a long walk to the hotel when you’re toting a case. A T-10 ticket costs 7 euros and allows you 10 journeys and can be shared between passengers - just run it through the machine twice. Also note that there are lifts to the platforms in most stations. So, I digress. The hotel is very good. It really does just become somewhere to sleep because Barcelona has so much going on there is no need to do anything else there. For restaurants I would strongly recommended blowing the budget and going for the menu degustacion at Cinc Sentits (book at least a week in advance) and try the Sommelier's wine pairings. A fantastic experience and sure to have a Michelin star before too long. For an a la carte menu try Hisop which is just the other side of Avenue Diagonal. Fabulous service and a really excellent wine list.

Reviews.Title: “A Barcelona Wedding”
Reviews.Author: ikiikipiki
Reviews.Content: Great location close to transportation, sites and restaurants. Modern in design and amenities. Staff spoke enough English to help us answer our questions. Complimentary breakfast was good. Bring your own iron since hotel doesn't offer one in every room. Request a room facing the street... the view is excellent. The rooftop patio is great and, although we didn't have time for it, two hot tubs are available. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sjaan20
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!!! Nice staff , clean and it's very new.(2006). Close to the La Ramblas! Good breakfast,nice jacuzie on the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: Bomy
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel is worth every penny. The reception personell is excellent and very helpful. We arrived early in the morning and wanted to check in at 10.30u and that was no problem. Also after the check out we were able to store our luggage at the hotel so we could do some more shopping until leave. One of the staff personell took our luggage to our room and explained how everything worked. The room was large with a even larger bathroom. A nice and hard shower stream with enough pressure and after a shower the floor didn't get wet ( in many hotels it is). We had 2 large beds (2,10 x 1,00mtr) next to eachother. The airco was fine and individually adjustable. There was a flat LCD television with overall spanish channels but also BBC World (English) and MTV (German). We had breakfast every morning (0700-1030) and there was enough to eat like fresh fruit, baked bread, cheese, ham, yoghurt, scrambled eggs, cornflakes etc.. The atmosphere in the hotel was luxurous with fine details like thick carpet in the hallway so you didn't hear anybody walking along your door. The sound insulation in the room was also okay. We didn't hear any guests. On top of the hotel you have a really large terrace with 2 jacuzzi's (one cold one hot) and this was open from 0700 till 2200u. Very nice! There were also a small health club where you could run and row. A dinner in the hotel was available for only 16,50 for 3 courses (we didn't consume this). The hotel is near a Metro station (5 min walk) and also a 5 min walk to the expensive shops like Prada, Gucci, Chanel and Louis Vutton. If you prefer luxury, comfort, neat, relaxing and not too crowded surrounding, then this is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: thesteils
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels I’ve stayed in. The staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms are quiet, spacious and well appointed. The location is perfect for all the attractions, eating out and the metro is only a 10min leisurely walk, which can take you anywhere you want to go in Barcelona. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is faultless. From the friendly english speaking staff giving you info on good local restaurants and cheap transport links when you arrive, to the immaculate rooms, I'd definitley go back here and strongly recommend it. I can only imagine the hotel is not rated as 5 Star as it doesn't have a swimming pool, but the two rooftop jacuzzi's more than make up for it. The views from the massive roof terrace are great. In one direction the sea, the other is Gaudi's cathedral and another has the hills in the distance. It's a great vantage point when relaxing. Even though the hotel is located on a 'main' junction on the road below, it was remarkably quiet, both on the terrace an in our room. We didn't hear one door slam or the maid cleaning rooms around ours in the four days we were there. The room was spacious, very clean with a large flatscreen TV, a safe, 2 built-in wardrobes with a 'wet room'-style shower in the bathroom. The bed was big and comfy and the blackout blinds worked a treat. The mini bar was also very reasonably priced compared to a lot of hotels (2.50 euros for a bottle of beer, 1.50 for water and cheap spirits should you see fit to treat yourself after a day sightseeing). We couldn't have asked for much more here and will be back if we return to the city. It's also down the road from Cerveseria Catalana, a restaurant you'll have to visit!

Reviews.Title: “See Barcelona from the Jacuzzi!”
Reviews.Author: AlJonesBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel located near the designer shops and a couple of good tapas bars. Hotel itself is very good, the rooms were large, clean, quiet and the beds are massive. They must have some good quality sound proofing because you didn't hear a sound from any other rooms or the street below. It was my partners 30th birthday while we were there and they kindly arranged a champagne breakfast in bed - partner very impressed and earned loads of browny points. The 2 jacuzzis on the room were lovely to come back to after a long day walking around the city - watch out though as they are not always heated!! Didn't actually eat in the hotel but the restaurant did look good. Would definately come back to this hotel if I get the chance to return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: neillni
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with limited food service. Just of Las Ramblas which is good as you escape the crowds but near enough to walk to any location in Barcelona. The rooms are very nice with everything you expect in a 4* hotel. will use this hotel again when i return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Read This”
Reviews.Author: abz911
Reviews.Content: hI just come back from barcelona with my girl friend and i have to tell you this hotel is awsome i upgraded my room to a superior room cst a bit more but was well worth it room was huge and looked so nicely done it had a flat screen tv speakers in the toilet even had a phone in the loo to and the jacuzzi was relly nice but watch out in the night cause one is cold :( Bad points i dont rate the hotel menu at all it is really limited brekfast isnt that great either and pricey and thats it other than that hotel was awsome and the staff fine room service was fast and room was cleaned everyday really well BARCELONA ITS SELF was good but expensive and nightlife isnt that great but its shopping haven so my mrs said but one of the best thing is all the hagen daz stores was real cool definantly worth going for 2-4 days max and take plenty of money even better take a credit car but you must carry id like a passport or license other wise some shops dont let you use them, food is ok but they relly do like there meat here so veggie food is hard to find PS when i booked this hotel it was rated number 4th out of 456 and now its 10 and if you have already booked dnt worry hotel is really nice and you will enjoy it also remeber people dnt really write good reviews they normally just like complaining other than that have fun people

Reviews.Title: “reasonably tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: BirdieS
Reviews.Content: Plush surroundings, and modern sleek room define this hotel, and the stay was a reasonably pleasurable one. The location is quite good, reasonably centrally located, and a 5-10 minute walk from Passeig de Gracia and Las Ramblas. The room - small(ish) but sleek and modern with a nice shower. The downside was that our room was inward facing so there was little natural light coming through and no view. Any room with "01" or "02" or "03" at the end will be the same. The breakfast - choice of tea, fresh juices, fresh fruit as well as the usual (breads, cheese, meats) with cooked items such as scrambled eggs, Spanish omelette, bacon. It is supposed to be a 4 star hotel however and I suppose I'd have expected a more extensive breakfast with friendlier service. Service - the bellboy was "not there" when we arrived, so we had to pick up our own bags, although they did offer to bring them up to us when the bellboy returned. Service was otherwise OK. I'd recommend this as a clean and pleasant hotel, without the bells and whistles of more luxurious (and expensive) hotels but good enough for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Away from the Maddening Crowds!”
Reviews.Author: t.carballo
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel situated ina lovely neighbourhood about 10mins walk from Plaza Catlunya. We stayed for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed every one. I've been to Barca on several occasions and this hotel was probably one of the best. Great rooms and undeniably the biggest bed I've ever slept on 2m X 2m I'm sure. A great tapas restaurant just around the corner is probaly one of the best in Barca too, it's called El Taller De Tapas, awesome try it!

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Center lived up to reviews!”
Reviews.Author: piwismum
Reviews.Content: Chose Barcelona Center mainly after reading reviews on this website. Excellent experience. Hotel 10 minute fast walk from aerobus drop off point in Placa de Catalunya (3 euros 80). Nice quiet location - had a rear room but didn't mind as no street noise at all (previously stayed on Las Ramblas and while great atmosphere really noisy well into early hours). Room immaculate - not huge but big enough with excellent bathroom. Beware charge for ice though! Didn't use any catering at hotel as preferred to eat out. As regards dining - recommend 'Cent Focs' - same street as hotel but back nearly to Placa de Catalunya. very reasonable, great service and atmosphere and lovely food. Don't miss Sagrada Familia - fantastic to see a building of this magnitude under construction - arrive early though....!

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly”
Reviews.Author: emmaLiverpool
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel!!! great location, great staff and a great jacuzzi terrace. very good location, although our feet were killing from all the walking! rooms are very modern, although the bed was hard. plenty of storage and a plasma acreen TV. breakfast was good although not alot of hot items. 15 mins walk to las ramblas, it was better being further out as it could get quite noisy in the centre. we planned to go to hard rock cafe one night but there was a 2 hour wait!! we found a great US diner restaurant on Balmes called hollywoods, we were a bit dubious at first as there was no one in there but the beers were 2 euro and the burgers were massive!! try this one instead. all in all agreat trip! if you are visiting the nou camp make sure you get here early, you can catch them training and its less ques.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tessa_123
Reviews.Content: The Barcelona center hotel is a great hotel for an ecxelent price. Our room was nicely decorated, had a huge bed a, nice bathroom and was very clean. The breakfast was good too and the jaccuzzi's on the roofterras were very nice as well. The staff was very helpfull, the only thing we didn't like was the nearby tapas restaurant they reccomended. The hotel is about 15 minute walk from the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “I had no complaints”
Reviews.Author: BOSLEY123
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights in July and it was very good. We had never been to BCN before and dont really have anything to compare it to but found it to be clean and in a very good location. We had a view of the street and never had any issues with noise. As for the breakfast we had it included in our package but only used it once. If the prices i see on here are right it would be overpriced so i would recommend just going to a shop and getting a panino or coffee and muffin. The rooms were modern and clean. They were a bit small but we didnt care as we were gone all day. The T.V selection was awful but some people may never use it. i would recommend this hotel to anyone if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Bit dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: wenbrug
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and rather modern, but the standard rooms are small and dark. We had a small window facing the rooms across with 6 meters inbetween. The bed is also rather hard. Further the restaurant is OK. We had dinner there the first day and it was OK for € 16,50. We had the idea that the staff was short on 1 pair of hands, but they were very polite and the food was OK. The whirlpools on the roof are nice and you have a nice view, but there is no music or anything so you get bored rather quick. The hotel is good for 1 or 2 nights but if you stay in Barcelona longer, i will choose a hotel with bigger rooms and a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying here for sun terrace alone”
Reviews.Author: Fussy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for a return visit to BCN with teenage daughter in July. Thought the similarity in decor to Casa Fuster where stayed on last visit a coincidence until realised was a sister hotel! Decor v pleasant- we found the beds comfy, bathrooms good- rooms not enormous but that seems the norm for BCN. Location good, similar distance to centre of activities to Casa Fuster, and away from the Ramblas that I find a little tacky to say the least. The road running between this and Paseig de Garcia is well worth a stroll- all in all a very pleasant troll down to the main centre of BCN. Our price reasonable- and the sun terrance with ample sun beds , 2 jacuzzis and loads of tables/chairs in my view makes this a perfect location for those that want a bit of R&R in between shopping and sight seeing- not the world's best view of the terrace but certainly good for taking some sunshine and leisure

Reviews.Title: “Brillant little Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MSW2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room! Beautiful roof deck, with Jacuzzi's ! Great location !

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: paljoey
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the Trip Advisor reviews, we booked two rooms at this hotel through Orbitxz. The hotel had no record of our reservation but did honor the reservation based on our printed confirmation from Orbitz. The people at the front desk were very nice. The room was tiny by US standards. It was very dark and the carpet was stained and worn. The bed was rock hard. I am not exaggerating. It was without a doubt the most uncomfortable night we have ever spent in a hotel, and we were exhausted having just traveled from Chicago. We were traveling on a cruise the next day and it was quite a relief to get on the ship. I would not recommend the Barcelona center to anyone nor would I ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5-star room at 3-star prices”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine12
Reviews.Content: Well, the reviews are right on this one! After staying in numerous hotels throughout europe, this one was a great place to end the trip. We paid the least, but got the most. At just over 100 euros, this room offered a comfy bed, huge, modern, clean washroom, tons of in-room space for luggage and big windows. The staff were really helpful and the roof-top jacuzzi (we didn't use it b/c we were too busy) looked great! The breakfast was too expenisve for us, but we just walked to local coffee shops for a bite to eat. Great tapas bar down the road. Make sure to treat yourself to a pitcher of sangria on your trip. The perfect refreshing treat to end a day of busy sightseeing. This city has so much going on!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cams561
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for three nights, we got to the hotel which is very conveniently located for the shops restaurants etc, there is a great Tapas bar just down the street which was recommended to us by the hotel recption. Breakfast is very expensive and although it is a nice buffet, the selection isn't all tat great. The rooms are very nicely decorated and spotlessly clean, as is the bathroom. My only fault would be that the lighting is very soft so the room almost verges on being a little dark! There is a large roof terrace with gym and hot tubs. I would definately stay here again, its close enough to be handy for all amenities (longish walk or short cab ride) and quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with quality rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: CatIrv
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on last minute.com and were guided to it by previous reviews. Got the aerobus to Placa de Catalunya and then walked the short 10-15 mins to the hotel - this was late at night but did not have any problem walking through the area which was really safe. The rooms are huge and are of a high standard decor with really thick curtains that dont let the light in which is great if you want a late lay in! Nice jacuzzi and terrace area on the roof. The only slight negative of our stay was that on our first morning we decided to have the hotel breakfast (not included in rate so paid seperately) and on checkout were shocked to find out that it was 17 euros each - whilst it was nice and of good quality, the choice was quite limited and no where near worth the total price of 34 euros plus tax!!!!! Anyway, Barcelona is great and would seriously recommend the "Fat Tire Bike Tours" - cant remember the name of the meeting point where the tour started but they have a website you can look at. The tour stopped off at a majority of the major sights in Barcelona and it was a great way to see it all with an informative guide. Ate out for a couple of nights in the restaurants in passag de gracia which is about 2 blocks along from the hotel - would recommend BaBaReBa for good quality food and service, however we would say No No to a restaurant called NoNo which had very basic and limited taste food and uninterested staff. On way back to the hotel on most nights we stopped off at the Haagan Daaz icecream parlour which is just one block away in Rambla de Catalunya. Would definately recommend the use of the Metro which is a quick and easy way to get round - they do a "one day travelcard" type thing for about 5 euros which is great value and allows you to go all over the city and sights. This was my second visit to Barcelona in a year and it didnt fail to wow me again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great city”
Reviews.Author: xray-on-the-go
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean.The staff all speak English and happy to help. The bar is open until 2am which is great for the late night drink. The rooms are perfect size and we got a little balcony. The rooms also have darkers with curtains so no light gets into the room if you want a lie in. We didnt try the breakfast buffet, but have heard that its great. Near the hotel (come out and turn left and right after one block) there is Cafet Fornet. They are a chain but they make fresh orange juice to die for and a great range of pastries. FOOD TIPS: La Cervecia Catalana was the best place we had tapas. Very fresh food and everyone spoke english. It is on the same road the hotel (Mallorca). Just come out the hotel, turn left and keep walkin for 2 blocks. Its number 236 on the right. It gets very very busy,s o aim to get there at midday for lunch. If you show up after half 12, you find a seat! Always ask for the menu because they dont put out a full diplay until around 1pm, so you might not appreciate their wide range of yummy delight. Fried baby squid are a delicacy, try them.
